column1: slides on with the arm outside off, Hafeez searches for turn and is beaten all ends up
Hafeez tees off with six over deep midwicket. Tossed outside off, another non-turner, he stretches out and slog-sweeps it away over the man in the deep
back of a length and breaks back in from wide of the crease, leans back and stabs it away to the covers
skids on outside off, some extra bounce from a length, zips past the outside edge
pushed through outside off, non-turner, again, driven through the line to the covers
Nyumbu nails a yorker, Hafeez ventures another slog-sweep and wears it on the pad/boot but outside the line of off stump. The batsman weathers the lbw appeal
good length and angling away just a shade outside off, Fakhar inches forward and defensively drops the ball to the leg side
slightly overpitched and outside off, Fakhar gets well forward and stabs it away through the gap at the covers
on a length and outside off, driven on the up to mid-off hanging back for a speedy single
back of a length and a hint of width outside off, enough for Fakhar to stand tall and punch it through extra cover
hip-high short ball on middle stump, Fakhar picks up the length swiftly. Rocks back and swats a pull to Mire at deep backward square leg

Hamilton Masakadza backtracks from mid-off and completes an excellent overhead catch. Hafeez skips down the track and aims to hoist Jarvis over the Zimbabwe captain's head. But, Jarvis sees the advancing batsman and digs this one into the middle of the pitch, finds some extra bounce and foils the timing. Spliced in the air. Over to you, Hamilton
back of a length, skids in to beat the batsman and ping the thigh pad. They sneak a leg bye
shorter and angling across off stump, Fakhar hangs back and jabs the ball straight to short cover
short, attacking off, Fakhar makes some room and chops to point

Fakhar stays leg-side of this short ball outside off and lashes it to extra cover, where Chigumbura throws himself to his left and intercepts the ball but he can't throw the stumps down. Fakhar nicks a risky single
slower offcutter just outside off, Talat reads it and tips it to point for one
Fakhar looks to drag one against the angle. Instead, he squirts an outside edge past lone slip to deep third man
on a length and slides on outside off from round the wicket, slapped to point
here comes Fakhar: down the track and hoicks it to mid-on off the inside half
here comes Fakhar again: he steps out, makes some room, this is a turning offbreak from Nyumbu. He is nowhere close to the pitch but manages to slice it over long-off for six
Fakhar forays down the track, gets too close to the pitch of this offbreak now, and hoicks it away straight of mid-on for back-to-back boundaries
flat dart, turns and bounces past the outside edge
Fakhar stays leg-side of this full ball outside off and crunches it straight to extra cover
Talat now ventures down the track, takes a half-volley from outside off and belts it past the right of mid-off and left of short cover. Bam!
slower ball but drifted into the pads, neatly picked off through backward square leg
on a length and kicks up outside off, Talat drives on the up... and misses
back of a length and angling across off stump, steered to deep third man with the angle for a single
shorter and outside off, slashes a cut to backward point
Fakhar moves away outside leg, Muzarabani still targets his head with a nasty short ball. Fakhar gets a big top edge on the hook. It flies over long leg for six
fuller than a good length and nipping away outside off with the angle, Talat wants to run it down to deep third man. No dice
down the track, meets a short ball outside off and slaps it on the up but finds backward point
Talat moves down the track again, gets another short ball outside off, this time he rides it down to deep third man, opening the face of the bat at the last moment
another top-edge, this one evades Muzarabani at short fine leg. Short, aimed at the body, miscues a hook and gets away as the ball sails over Muzarabani
slower offcutter, does not bounce at all, Talat goes for the pull but the ball grips and just bounces over leg stump
Talat runs down the track and belts it straight down the ground, so much so takes it down a stump at the non-striker's end
on a length and angling away too wide outside off, past the tramline, off-side wide
just short of a good length and angling away outside off, slashed away to sweeper cover off the back foot

Chibhabha has Talat snicking behind. Back of a length and slanting away outside off from over the wicket, Talat seeks to steer it down to deep third man. Instead, he tickles it much finer to Moor behind the stumps
back of a length and on the hips, swatted away to deep square leg
very full and angling across off stump, smeared away to the right of short cover and left of sweeper cover
overpitched and outside off, smashed away to mid-off, where Burl lets the ball burst through his hands. The force of the shot ensured the ball burst out
back of a length and angling into leg stump, deflected away to fine leg
pretty full and angling into middle stump, squeezed away through the vacant spaces at midwicket
drift and turn, Sarfraz presses forward to smother it
low full-toss, skids in on off, Sarfraz aims the leg side but ends up scooping a leading edge to the left of the bowler
worked with the incoming angle through midwicket
looped up slower, higher, and wider, Fakhar throws his bat at the ball and carves it up and over backward point
on a length and turning into the pads, nudged gently enough through midwicket for a couple of runs
on a length and outside off, mis-hits a drive to the right of mid-on. Weak shot
back of a length and slanting away outside off, jabbed through the line to sweeper cover
Sarfraz rides the bounce of this shortish ball in the channel and guides it away square of deep third man
back of a length and angling into a solid punch down to long-on
wide yorker, squirted fine of deep third man now
another excellent wide yorker, sneaks under the swinging bat
backs away to spear a tossed up ball on leg stump straight to cover
lifts it over the infield, having made room outside leg stump and the full ball on leg stump is carved over point and it skips all the way to the boundary
races down the pitch to smack a length ball to the long-on boundary. Sensational from the Pakistan captain. The quickness of his feet...
draws a wide down the leg side and the keeper mucks it up as Sarfraz leaves, gleefully. Five wides
full on off stump, blocks towards point. Sarfraz wants a single, without realising Chigumbura at point was far too close. Just about makes it back
full on middle and off, blocks

leading edge and a simple catch at cover! Gorgeous work from Chisoro, holding the length back a touch, pulling the pace off the ball too. Sarfraz plays the original line of the ball, drifting into leg stump, looking for a single to midwicket. He's early on the shot and he's off to the dressing room early as well
stands still against a very full delivery on off stump - no feet really - and plonks it to mid-off

run-out chance! And it comes off a low full toss, which Zaman steers to the left of cover and hares out for a single. He's more than halfway down, not realising Malik has no interest in the run at all. Eventually he stops, turns, sprints for dear life and makes his crease. Poor throw in from the captain Masakadza
knocks it square on the off side, into a much more vacant spot around point, to secure a single
short and wide, slaps it behind point and the uber tall Blessing Muzarabani does well to save the boundary at third man
fullish delivery on off stump, blocks
full on off stump, drives back at the bowler
full and outside off, Zaman launches it to the sweeper cover
shortish on off stump, and Malik picks that length ever so early, rocking back to punch to long-on

mis-hits it over the top of the bowler! And it carries all the way - despite his being a bit off-balance. The bowler sees him coming down the pitch and shifts the line wide outside off, to possibly stump the left-hander. But Zaman reaches out and smashes it over long-off. It was shots like these that won the Champions Trophy for Pakistan
good length ball on off stump, cuts behind point
too short, too far down leg and Malik helps it on its way to the fine leg boundary. Easy-peasey

gorgeous work! This is by no means short. Or even too far wide outside off. But Malik is able to slink back into his crease and play a superb late cut. Muzarabani has a bit more work to do, and he just about flicks the ball back before the rope
another gimme ball - short and wide outside off - and Malik crashes it to the point boundary to become only the third player to get to 2000 runs in T20I cricket after McCullum and Guptill
full on middle and leg, squeezes it out to deep midwicket
neat little flick off his toes for a single to deep midwicket

slower ball on leg stump, he ticks it through square leg to bring up his second T20I fifty. But even as he celebrates, he gets a warning from umpire Tiffin for running down the danger area of the pitch

another slower ball, but it's short, and Zaman makes himself the room he needs to hammer it to the left of the sweeper cover. It's about to skip away to the boundary but Musakanda throws himself headfirst at the ball and flicks it back, much like McCullum used to do in the 2015 World Cup. Superb cricket!
good length and simply zips through outside off with extra bounce, Fakhar top-edges a cut fine of short third man for four
really full on middle, not much turn either way, smoothly driven down to long-off for one
tossed just a shade outside off, Malik lunges out and eases a single to long-off now

Dropped by Jarvis diving to his right from wide long-on. Talking about adding injury to insult. Jarvis collapses in pain. Pushed through outside off, Fakhar Zaman clears his front leg and hoicks it over the leg side. The physio is out to tend to Jarvis and now he leaves the field. Hit flat and hard, and Jarvis has injured his bowling hand. Zimbabwe can't afford any more losses. They've already lost as many as five frontline players, including Raza and Cremer
floated up outside off, forward and patted into the covers
dangled up outside off, down the track and laced against the break to long-on for one
middle-stump full-toss, punched up to long-on
full-toss outside off, swatted away to deep midwicket
another full-toss, on off, stabbed away only as far as the bowler

Chisoro floors the leg stump and pumps his fist. Back of a length and fizzes off the pitch - quicker dart from the left-arm spinner - Fakhar looks to muscle it over the leg side but loses his shape in the process. Chisoro sends the leg stump cartwheeling. What a sight for a bowler!
Chisoro hits a hard length outside off, the batsman hangs back and punches back to the bowler
off-stump yorker, jabbed down to long-off
pitched up and outside off, driven down to long-off
back of a length on middle, punched up to mid-off for a quick single
picked off to fine leg
back of a length on middle stump, Malik backs away and slaps it away to backward point
really full and angling into off stump, right up Ali's swinging zone, he gets under the length and smites it over the wide long-on fence

this is full and holds its line outside off again, poor lengths from Chibhabha, especially at this pace, Ali gets under it again and smokes this straight down the ground. He sends the ball soaring over Chibhabha's head
pushed through on middle and leg, squeezed away to deep midwicket
low full-toss on off stump, he gets forward ad stabs it to the covers
arm ball, sliding in from around the wicket, Ali plays around his front pad and falls over the flick
really full on middle stump, pushed straight back to the bowler
back of a length on middle stump. Ali aims a leg-side mow but ends up dragging it straighter to long-on
Malik ventures outside leg, the bowler follows him with a front-of-the-hand yorker and pings the pad. Fine finish to the over for Zimbabwe
really full and sliding into the pads, he twirls his wrists, picks it up and flicks it over short fine leg flat and hard
shorter and outside off, gets on top of the bounce and pulls it away to deep midwicket
too full and outside off, gets underneath the length and smears it away to wide long-off
low full-toss outside off, slogs and toe-ends it away to wide long-on
slower full ball, angling into off stump, muscled away to the right of Ryan Burl at short midwicket
full - wrong length - and outside off, Malik clears his front leg. Lines up this poor ball and launches it nice and clean over long-off. Lovely extension of the arms
pretty full on off again, slower one, Ali reads it. He gets underneath the length and crisply drives it over the bowler's head. Lands just in front of the sightscreen
looks like a slower legcutter outside off, good length, Ali does not read this change-up. He swings, loses his shape, and does not make contact with the ball that swerves away in the channel
Mire ventures yet another legcutter but has pushed it wider past the tramline. Off-side wide
back-of-a-length offcutter, Ali waits for the ball to arrive, then loads up and pulls in the air in front of deep midwicket
dipper on the leg stump, a la Dwayne Bravo, swiped away to cow corner
high full-toss outside off, swung away to long-on. Above the waist? On the waist, hence the bowler gets away
Malik moves away outside leg even before the bowler delivers. He drifts a slower ball past the batsman on the leg side. Poor stuff from Mire
slower yorker, dips on middle, dug back to the bowler
low full-toss, angling in to off stump, hard-to-hit delivery, dragged away to the right of long-on
good change-up. Slower cutter outside off, befuddles Malik who was looking to thump it across the line over midwicket
on a length on middle and leg, swiped away to deep midwicket. Malik hares back for the second
full and wide outside off, driven away to sweeper cover with a slicing finish
slower ball, back of a length on middle, Ali waits for it to arrive. Then picks it up, manufactures his own pace, and slams it up and over midwicket with immense power
full-toss just a shade outside off, swiped away to square leg. The ball swirls away from a diving Mire. In the end, Pakistan secure three runs to finish well
starts off with a quick arm ball, darted in, chipped in the air but past the outstretched left hand of the diving bowler
another arm ball, snakes back and hits the pad as the batsman hangs back and plays all around it
picked off the pads to the right of short midwicket for one
tossed up, drifts in, defended to the covers off the front foot
tossed up on off, dips, creating distance between the bat and pitch. Prodded back to the bowler

another arm ball, this fetches Nawaz a wicket. Slid in with the angle from around the stumps, catches Chibhabha on the crease. He plays around his front pad and is trapped in front of middle. That's very adjacent
fuller than a good length and skidding into leg stump, draws a leading edge that drops in front of cover
short and angling away just outside off, hangs back and punches back to Usman Khan
hip-high short ball on leg stump, you've got to get it up higher. Rocks back and cracks a pull to the square leg fence
short on off, jabbed only as far as point
back of a length and slanting away outside off, the batsman stays leg-side of the ball and forces it to the covers

Ashraf throws himself to his right at mid-on and stops this rocket pull. Dug in outside off, muscled away off the back foot. The ball seemed destined to fly to the boundary... until Ashraf's athletic intervention
tossed on middle stump, stretches out and laces to long-off
fired outside leg as the batsman pre-meditates a reverse-sweep and misses
drifts in with the arm, the batsman swings down the wrong line and connects only with thin air
flicked with the angle to the right of mid-on for one
on a length and just a shade outside off, punched off the front foot to cover
fired in on off, uses his feet and quietly taps it to cover
leg-side wide. Re-set the radar, Faheem
inducker, zips back in from a hard length, Mire camps in the crease and squirts it onto the pad off an inside edge
back of a length and slanting in to hit the thigh as Mire falls over the leg-side flick
back of a length and slanting in at middle, shuffles across off for a flick and takes it on the thigh again
back of a length and angling into a back-foot defence on off stump. Played back to the bowler
length ball, angling into off stump, Mire has a big swish at this incoming ball and drags it in the air over midwicket
that's a golf swing into the stands beyond wide long-on. Pitched up and outside off, Mire lines it up and smokes it away like a boss
and beats the outside edge right away. Fuller than a good length, angling in, then straightening away past the bat. Gem of a ball
on a length and holds its line outside off, Hamilton Masakadza stretches across off, goes low, and scoops it into the deserted stands beyond fine leg. Great response from the Zimbabwe captain
this is a battle! Hamilton uses his feet, Hasan pulls his length back on middle. Spliced pull to midwicket
lifter on middle stump, no way you can scoop it over fine leg. Sarfraz leaps to collect the ball.

Hasan Ali wins this battle! here comes Hamilton: down the track and looks for the booming drive through the covers. But this full ball swings away, fetches the outside edge, straightforward catch for Sarfraz behind the stumps
full and angled down the leg side for a wide
Hasan hits a hard length, defended on off stump from the crease
full on middle, opens the face and guides the ball to short cover
Mire ventures outside leg and slaps a short ball from outside off to the covers, where the fielder has a shy at the stumps and concedes an overthrow
rides the bounce of a short ball angling away outside off and secures a single down to deep third man
bouncer on leg stump, Mire aims to get under it and ramp it away. No dice
back of a length on off and middle, chopped to third man from the stumps
wafted to square leg off an inside edge to round out the over
good length and turns away outside off, tapped to short cover off the back foot
tossed up and breaks away outside off, drags a sweep against the break to deep midwicket
googly, the batsman picks it and clips it with the turn through midwicket. Ali fumbles at gives away three runs in the end
full-toss on middle stump, eased down to long-on, another fumble, another three
tossed on middle, glanced towards short fine leg for one
straighter one, takes it on the pad as he misses the sweep
Musakanda gets on top of a short ball outside off and laces it to sweeper cover
full and slanting in from over the wicket to catch the pad but this is heading down leg with the sharp angle
full and just a shade outside off, driven to the right of short midwicket
banged in short and outside off, rides the bounce and controls a pull to deep backward square leg
on a length and on a sixth-stump line, driven on the up to the right of mid-off. He's timed the pants off this. Well done, Musakanda
back of a length and skidding in towards off stump, Musakanda closes the face and works it quietly to square leg
swept from the stumps to long leg
on a length and spins away outside off, Mire stretches out, gets close to the pitch and nails a sweep against the turn over deep square leg
chopped away to short third man as this slides on outside off
too full for the sweep, the batsman still dares to sweep. Dragged away to deep midwicket
tossed up slower on off stump, blocked off the front foot
shuffles across off and whips a skidder between deep midwicket and wide long-on. They rush back for the second
backs away and stabs a short ball from outside leg to the covers
on a length and outside off, shovels a sweep to deep midwicket
tossed up on middle stump, Mire goes for a biiiiig sweep but does not get all of it. He simply skies it in the air. Hasan Ali settles under this nicely. Zimbabwe three down
back of a length and angling in towards off stump, hangs back and turns it defensively to the leg side
very full on middle stump, run away to the right of Nawaz for one
dangled up outside off, whipped across the line to wide long-on
shuffles outside leg, then gets in line and works a single to the leg side
googly, takes the inside edge and wanders away to the leg side
half-tracker outside off, clubbed wide of deep midwicket. Moor hustles back for the second
quick fizzer outside off, hacked away to wide long-on
back of a length and breaks away outside off, punched through the line to the covers
Shadab bursts through the defences of Moor. Pushed through on off stump, spins in, Moor looks to heave the wrong'un across the line. He misses, Shadab, however, hits his target
just short of a good length and outside off, Musakanda stands tall and short-arms it over midwicket with great authority. Crunched off the middle of the bat
short, hits the splice, miscues a pull to midwicket
short, angling into off stump, the ball does not come onto the bat. The batsman pulls early and flaps it in the air over midwicket
back of a length and zips through the channel. Musakanda ventures a pull and misses
overpitched on off stump, drilled down the ground to long-on
back of a length and angling into a push to the right of short cover
full and skidding into the pads, deflected away fine
heaved across the line to wide long-on
drifts in and turns away, checks his push and dabs to short cover
full on the stumps, skewed down to long-on off the inside half
back of a length on off, defensively dropped to the covers
arm ball, snakes in, takes the inside edge and rolls away past leg stump
back of a length and angling into off stump, punched away to mid-off. Chigumbura strays out of the crease and searches for a quick single but he is sent back. A direct hit could have had Chigumbura
lifter on middle, ducks under it. Too high and that has been called a wide
hip-high short ball on middle stump, Chigumbura shifts his balance onto the back foot and wallops it away over midwicket. Strong swing of the arms
on a length and outside off, Chigumbura stays leg-side of the ball and carts it over the top of the covers

six, four, and out! Nice comeback from Hasan Ali. Slower offcutter from Hasan, Chigumbura does not pick the variation, as he's early into his big shot. Hasan hits the off stump and sends it cartwheeling
full and angling in on off from round the wicket, presses forward and bunts it to short cover
looks like another slower ball outside off, muscled to point
tossed on middle, drilled down to long-off off the front foot
skids on middle, forced away to long-on
flighted on the pads, Burl presses forward and bunts the ball to short midwicket
dragged down on leg stump, pulled to square leg off the back foot
flat dart, slides on off stump, punched away past the right of Shadab
very full and outside off, slugs a sweep to deep midwicket
back of a length on top of off, leans back, opens the face and punches it away to third man
just short of a good length and outside off, pulled away with the wrists to deep backward square leg
back of a length and running away outside off with the angle, Burl has a leg-side now and under-edges it but it does not carry to Sarfraz
Musakanda makes room outside leg, the bowler drags a slower short ball away from his reach. Beaten outside off
full on off, swiped away between deep midwicket and wide long-on
length ball on off, he has another swipe and drags it to deep midwicket off the inside half
Usman bowls a heavy ball on off stump. Musakanda looks to ping it over the leg-side infield. Instead, he skews a catch to Shadab at mid-off. It's all going pear-shaped for Zimbabwe
full and wide outside off, Burl, having nipped down the track, slices over backward point
off-stump yorker, swings in late, dug out
full and outside off, belted to the long-on fielder off the front foot

Usman has Chisoro nicking off. No celebration at all from the bowler. Fuller than a good length, angling in from wide of the crease, then straightening away in the channel. Chisoro, who is rooted to the crease, stabs at the moving ball and hands a catch to Sarfraz
off-stump yorker from round the wicket, jammed out to leg side
tossed on middle, Burl moves away outside leg and lofts it inside out to the right of long-off
Hafeez tosses an offbreak up on off stump, Burl shapes for a reverse-sweep but the extra bounce Hafeez generates means the top edge is found. Lobbed to short third man, where Malik takes it with ease
flighted and outside off, dragged to short midwicket
clipped with the turn to deep square leg
Hafeez tosses up another offbreak, starts outside off and breaks back in. Muzarabani aims for a mighty leg-side swipe but the bowler sneaks through his defences and hits the top of middle stump
